import { Story, Preview, Props } from "@storybook/addon-docs/blocks";
import { Switch } from "../../../Components/Atom";

# Switch
```import { switch } from "@elevenia/master-ui/Components/Atom";```

Switch component has a function as same as a checkbox. It appears like a switch gives true or false value.

<Story id="atom-switch--default" />

<br />

## Utils Props

There's no specific utility props for this component.

## Component Props
<Props of={Switch} />

### onChange (mandatory)

`label` prop is the title or description of switch.
<br />

<Preview>
  <Story id="atom-switch--label-on-left" />
</Preview>

### checked (mandatory)

`label` prop is the title or description of switch.
<br />

<Preview>
  <Story id="atom-switch--label-on-left" />
</Preview>

### label

`label` prop is the title or description of switch.
<br />

<Preview>
  <Story id="atom-switch--label-on-left" />
</Preview>

### labelPosition

`labelPosition` prop defines label position either on the left or on the right of switch. Without `labelPosition` prop, label position will be on the left of switch.
<br />

<Preview>
  <Story id="atom-switch--label-on-right" />
</Preview>

### labelInside

`labelInside` prop is boolean. The true value will enable label inside the switch which tells its status (ON or OFF).
<br />

<Preview>
  <Story id="atom-switch--label-inside" />
</Preview>
